Sure, to query more information about the top pools, you can add more fields to the GraphQL query for each pool. Here's an example of a query that retrieves additional information about the top 10 pools sorted by TVL:
```typescript
{
  pools(first: 10, orderBy: totalValueLockedUSD, orderDirection: desc) {
    id
    token0 {
      symbol
      name
      decimals
      totalSupply
    }
    token1 {
      symbol
      name
      decimals
      totalSupply
    }
    feeTier
    tick
    liquidity
    sqrtPrice
    feeGrowthGlobal0X128
    feeGrowthGlobal1X128
    totalValueLockedUSD
    volumeUSD
  }
}
```
In this query, we have added more fields to retrieve more detailed information about each pool. For example, we are retrieving the `name`, `decimals`, and `totalSupply` of both tokens in the pool. We are also retrieving the `feeTier`, `tick`, `liquidity`, `sqrtPrice`, `feeGrowthGlobal0X128`, and `feeGrowthGlobal1X128` values of each pool, which can be useful for analyzing the liquidity and trading behavior of each pool. Finally, we are still retrieving the `totalValueLockedUSD` and `volumeUSD` fields to sort the pools by TVL and 24Hr volume.

You can customize this query to retrieve any additional information that you need by adding or removing fields as necessary.
